bill_title: preclude mitigated, corrected, uncorrected effects, or reduction in benefits when determining an award for benefits which may be subjected to the provisions governing temporary, partial, permanent partial or permanent total disability benefits.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to preclude mitigated, corrected, uncorrected effects, or reduction in benefits when determining an award for benefits which may be subjected to the provisions governing temporary, partial, permanent partial or permanent total disability benefits. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 62-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No reduction in an award of compensation for temporary partial, or temporary total, permanent partial or permanent total loss or impairment may be made because the ability of the claimant's injury or condition is improved, aided, treated, or relieved by the use of medication, pain relieving treatment, devices including prosthetics, or any other ameliorative aid. During the period of treatment for the injury or condition, necessary and reasonable medical treatment shall be provided by insurer or employer in accordance with chapter 62-4. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
